original_solution_mapping.L3: 20 cents will buy 1 candy so 100 cents will buy 100/20 = <<100/20=5>>5 candies

original_function_code:
def solve():
    """Index: 2292.
    Returns: the number of candies the friend can purchase.
    """
    # L1
    fraction_given = Fraction(1, 4) # one-quarter of his feeding allowance
    feeding_allowance = 4 # feeding allowance is $4
    money_given_to_friend = fraction_given * feeding_allowance

    # L3
    cents_per_dollar = 100 # WK
    candy_cost_cents = 20 # candies cost 20 cents apiece
    money_given_to_friend_cents = money_given_to_friend * cents_per_dollar
    candies_purchased = money_given_to_friend_cents / candy_cost_cents

    # FA
    answer = candies_purchased
    return answer

logical_steps.solution_line_template: 20 cents will buy 1 candy so {money_given_to_friend_cents} cents will buy {money_given_to_friend_cents}/{candy_cost_cents} = <<{money_given_to_friend_cents}/{candy_cost_cents}={candies_purchased}>>{candies_purchased} candies

flawed_nl_reconstruction.L3: 20 cents will buy 1 candy so 1 cents will buy 1/20 = <<1/20=1/20>>1/20 candies

explanation: Incorrect operand. The variable 'money_given_to_friend' (value: 1) was used instead of 'money_given_to_friend_cents' (value: 100).
